pages.text: Certain metals and other materials exhibit a property of conducting a field of energy known as a Flux Field.$(br)These fields can be measured using two units: $(l)FFA$() and $(l)FSA$().

$(l)FFA$() stands for Flux Field Amplitude, and is a measure of the amount of energy in a certain object. $(l)FSA$() on the other hand stands for Flux Shift Amplitude, and is a measure of the change in FFA over a static period of one tick (1/20th of a second).
